name: The Villalobos Brothers
description:
'''The Villalobos Brothers''' are a Mexican trio of violinists, singer-songwriters, composers, and multi- instrumentalists. They have performed at the [[Latin Grammys|Latin Grammy Awards]], [[Carnegie Hall]], the [[Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum]], the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]], the [[United Nations|60th Anniversary of the United Nations]], the [[Rainbow Room|Rainbow Room at Rockefeller Center]], the [[New York Mets]] field at [[Shea Stadium]], and other historic venues.

The Villalobos Brothers have accompanied and collaborated with many international artists, including [[Morley (singer)|Morley]], [[Paloma San Basilio]], [[Paddy Moloney|Paddy Moloney and The Chieftains]],{{citation needed|date=November 2013}} [[Eddie Palmieri]], [[Graciela]], [[Dolly Parton]], [[León Gieco]], [[Leni Stern]], [[César Camargo Mariano]], [[Lila Downs]], [[Richie Ray & Bobby Cruz]], [[Pierre Boulez]], Alberto Vázquez, [[Johnny Ventura]], [[Dan Zanes]] and [[Rafael Escalona]]. Their first solo album, ''Villa-Lobos'', was released in 2009.
